title: BUZZ-Bouygues : Telecom's high capex, lack of near-term targets weigh
text:
** JP Morgan points to the lack of a mid-term revenue target

** Analysts also flag high capex - EUR 1.5 bln per annum over 2021-25 and EUR 1.4 bln in 2026

** "We suspect the near-term share reaction may prove focused on the disappointing nearer term messages around EBITDA margins and capital intensity," JPM says

** Bouygues Telecom eyes 2026 EBITDA of EUR 2.5 bln ($3.04 bln) and FCF of around EUR 0.6 bln

** Credit Suisse says targets are very ambitious and points to 2020 estimates of EBITDA and FCF of 1.5 bln and EUR 250 mln respectively

** Bouygues generates the bulk of its sales from its construction division, but telecoms is the fastest-growing division

** Shares were down over 7% in the last 12 months as of Thursday close

($1 = 0.8234 euros)
